trans-unit.source: Specifies a built-in page that can render exception and error information to mobile devices.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This page is internal and used by the adaptive error handling mechanism to provide error messages that are formatted appropriately for the target device.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ErrorFormatterPage"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns information about an exception.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is used by the adaptive error handling mechanism which provides error messages appropriately formatted for specific target devices.
A <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileErrorInfo"></xref> object containing information about the error.
Initializes the content of the error page, based on the error information retrieved.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The base implementation creates the mobile controls necessary to render the error.
This property is internal and used by the adaptive error handling mechanism.
Loads any saved view-state information to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object containing the saved view state.
Internally, this is typically a <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> or <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> object.
Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.OnInit%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to customize the event data for the adapter.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.
there is no exception stored in the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref>.
Saves any view or control state information for the page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object in which to store the view-state information.
